Posts.Content: Sep 1, 2008 02:34PM Hitchy wrote: Hi, I also had a bilateral and experienced bouts of crying and depression. My nurse said it was normal to feel that way. Our hormones are going crazy right now trying to figure out what's happening. I take xanax when I need to. Especially on chemo day and to help me sleep. I'm about six weeks out from my surgery and still have days when I cry alot. It's a huge loss and our bodies and spirits need time to grieve. I just let it come and most of the time I feel better after a good cry. Speak with your doctor about it and see if he can give you something to help. Take care, we're here for you, Laurie
